annotation.TEXT: Now, grab this power up and enter the pipe.
I wonder what that twist could be?
Be careful of this sliding guy.
...my 2012 vanilla level! Let's just start up a new game real quick here...
Dodge a few bullets and a couple members of the Thwomp family here...
Well, first of all. I put a little more info in Yoshi's House, so let's look at that.
There's gotta be something special in here!
You get to hit one, and only one of these switches, and that determines how hard the second trip will be.
Deal with these bad guys as usual, and watch out for the Chuck on the far right that'll possibly leap in this direction. Also, ignore the pipe below for now.
Now, you could just trash the goomba or use it to kill the Wiggler or Hammer Bro, but try to keep it alive instead.
Okay, more koopas. Should be fun to trash 'em!
Hello, and welcome to...
Gee, I wonder why this room is shaped this way... Also there's a reason the room starts like this with the autoscrolling.
Suddenly, we're in a forest. Jump to the upper-left to find an intentionally semi-hidden flower.
Oh, crap. I hope I can get up there in time.
Instead, take a shell, and kick it right up here to find a P-switch.
There's also a Chuck that'll bounce up the mushroom platforms if you let him, but he's not a big deal.

Okay, now the level on the right is not my contest entry. It's actually a vanilla level I started working on, but I changed my mind about partway through. It's still playable, but only the main area up to midpoint was completed. I'm not going to be showing any of that here, though.
There's normally a red parakoopa in that line of coins that you'd end up stomping, but I kind of whacked it with a tossed buzzy a few seconds ago!
Ow, that guy's a jerk! Actually, I probably could've bounced off him to reach the clouds, but it's intended that you use the P-switch to do that.
Be fast about grabbing the goods, as the coins are only there while the P-switch remains in effect!
Wow, I suck. Also, there's more of those dotted blocks. You'll be seeing plenty of them throughout the level.
I can still get some coins, though. Now, if only there was a way to guarantee that that seemingly luck-based moon could be reached...
Clean out the coins and grab the flower in the corner.
Yeah, remember all those dotted blocks you saw throughout the level? This is what they're there for.
Okay, made it! And in this door we find one of the many bonus rooms!
Red is more challenging, but still reasonable. However, blue is even harder, and borderline-Kaizo in some places (which is intentional).
This Yoshi coin can be reached by bouncing off the shell, but...
Don't worry about the enemies in the room below. And yes, that Yoshi coin is unreachable, for now...
Obviously, try to stop the yellow koopa from getting to his shell (should be very easy).
If you failed to reveal the P-switch with the goomba, you can also use one of these guys, but you'll have to get through three Wigglers, which might use up some shells.
You can also bullet hop, which is probably easier. Also, ignore everything in the room below. They're not important now.

Also, both red and blue allow access to every secret in the level's second visit, so if you just want to find everything, you can just go with red, which is what I'll be showing next time! (Yellow can get all the Yoshi coins, but can't reach every bonus room.)
Here, you'll either find a kicked shell, or a koopa kicking the shell, depending on what the game felt like doing. Try to grab the shell if you can.
Also, I went with vines here instead of a fence, because it seems easier to get on and off of vines compared to the fence.
Next, deal with the swoopers, try not to get injured (like me), and go up the pipe to exit.
I wonder if anyone has noticed the twist I put on a somewhat overused classic reference here.
After cleaning up here and hitting midpoint, go through the door.
Yeah, you can't get everything on your first trip, and if you choose Easy mode for the second trip, you're locked out of a bunch of bonuses.
You can get a bunch of coins and a power up here. When you're done, aim for the vertical line of coins on the right to ensure you land safely.

...breaking the fourth pair opens up a pipe that you can go down. However, assuming you've gotten at least 30 coins so far (and you should've), you might want to hit the star block to the right of it first.
Let's see what this P-switch does!
Don't bother trying to enter any of these pipes. None of them are exit-enabled. Also, be careful of the last jumping piranha plant. It spits out fireballs.
Okay, now you can't go to the right from here on the first trip, so don't bother. The pipe below leads to the next section, but I'm not going to be going that way.
Ow! Stupid Blargg!

Okay, now jump to this platform under the bridge to get a Yoshi coin and a hidden mushroom. (You might have just seen a P-switch door back there. That's one of the bonus rooms, but you can't access it on your first trip through the level.)
Nuts, I wanted to hit that Chuck with the goomba. Oh, well. When the coast is clear, step onto the platform below and ride it to the bridges up above.
You can reach this Yoshi coin by bouncing off the springboard.
Okay, so far so good...
Stomp the P-switch, and climb up to the clouds. There, you'll find a bunch of coins, another power up, and a hidden 1-up if you jump in the right spot.
If you want a lot of coins, do not collect those four coins to the left of this power up block yet!
I'll be showing what this P-switch is for momentarily, but for now, I want to leave most of these coins floating in the air.
MOOOOOONNN!!! Now, to get this moon, you have to fail all five 1-up chances here!
That way, you can reveal that P-switch more easily.
This way, you can use it to get a load of coins from this multi-coin block, along with a power up. Now, you could also use the ice blocks to hit these, but you won't get a load of coins that way.
Looks like your typical hit ? blocks and trash koopas level to begin with...
Entering this cave, we get to beat up more dudes and hit more blocks.
We're nearing the end here. Ride this skull raft down and watch out for Blarggs!
Back out here, we're just to the right of the star block. Yes, you can actually revisit that bonus room, but there's no point unless you want an extra flower.
All these turn blocks are breakable. The first three pairs aren't really special, but...

To get over this wall, you can either bounce off the parakoopa, shell jump, or go down the orange pipe. If you go down the pipe, hold left and Y or X if you want to land on the wall instead of shooting completely over it. This way, you can jump from the wall to the clouds on the left to get a bunch of coins.
Now, you see, if I had failed all five of them, I could've hit this P-switch and dropped all the way down for the moon.
Nuts! I fail at failing...
Bounce on the note blocks here, and try to get to the upper row.
Here is my actual vanilla contest level, "Switch Block City". Let's start!
Aw, nuts. I missed a coin there. It is possible to get them all if you aim right. Also, see all those dotted blocks? They will become important for the second trip through the level.
It is certainly possible to make the boss battle unwinnable, so I had to make sure there was a reset pipe.
Now, green is ridiculously easy, and gives you tons of feathers, but also blocks off most bonus areas. Yellow is more balanced, but slightly easy in some places.

Also, if you screen scroll to the left while hanging here on this vine, you can farm lives here. I spotted this during testing, but decided to leave it in. Most classic Mario games should have a life-farming spot!
Watch out for the Hammer Bro when you get up there. Fortunately, his hammers don't rain down on you while he's offscreen.
And, the bonus room exit brings you to this lava cave. (This is also where that other pipe in the forest would take you as well.)
